Key Match Events: Cade Povich struck out 10 while pitching into the eighth inning
The White Sox were shut out for the 16th time
Nick Nastrini allowed four hits and six walks in 1 2/3 innings
Ryan O’Hearn and Anthony Santander hit consecutive RBI doubles in the first
Colton Cowser drew a bases-loaded walk
Eloy Jiménez’s popup resulted in an error by third baseman Miguel Vargas, allowing three runners to score
Andrew Benintendi was called out on strikes despite the pitch appearing high
Benintendi was ejected along with Grady Sizemore for arguing the call
Pre-Game Insights: The White Sox dropped to 31-109 and became the first team since 1900 with at least three losing streaks of 12 games in the same season
Grady Sizemore, Chicago’s interim manager, was ejected for the first time since taking over
Post-Match Reflections: The White Sox made a feeble offensive showing against Povich
Baltimore retook the AL East lead, moving a half-game ahead of the Yankees
The Orioles won the series opener 13-3 on Monday, and in that game they had 27 plate appearances with men in scoring position in just eight offensive innings
The following night, they had 12 in the first two innings
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox had an uncompetitive start by Nick Nastrini
The Orioles scored four runs in the second without a hit
Cedric Mullins followed with a walk — Nastrini’s fifth of the inning
Mullins added an RBI single in the fourth
Santander hit a sacrifice fly in the fifth
Santander lifted a popup similar to Jiménez’s in the second
